io.github.nullptr.tools.receiver.keyed

Class KeyedReceiverManager<Key,RawData,Data,Rcv extends KeyedReceiver<Key,RawData,? extends Data>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.nullptr.tools.receiver.keyed.KeyedReceiverManager<Key,RawData,Data,Rcv>
  • Type Parameters:
    Key - The type of the key in the receivers map entry, usually a String with a channel name.
    RawData - The raw data type of the event, usually a String or a Byte[].
    Data - The data type of the event, converted, usually with Gson, from the raw data.
    Rcv - The type of the receiver, extending from KeyedReceiver.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PubSubManager

    public abstract class KeyedReceiverManager<Key,RawData,Data,Rcv extends KeyedReceiver<Key,RawData,? extends Data>>
extends java.lang.Object
    The keyed receiver manager is responsible for managing the receivers by key. Multiple receivers can be registered for one key, and will be notified when the fireEvent(Object, Object) is called, usually on message received.
